sub_topic: Finding the Hamiltonian cycle in a graph.
message_1:
Find the Hamiltonian Cycle in the following graph:

![Hamiltonian Cycle Graph](https://i.imgur.com/Y08b8xg.png)

Note: The Hamiltonian cycle must visit all vertices exactly once and end at the starting vertex.
message_2:
To find the Hamiltonian Cycle in the given graph, we can start at any vertex and try to visit all other vertices exactly once and return to the starting vertex. Let's start at vertex A:

A possible Hamiltonian Cycle is: A -> B -> C -> D -> E -> F -> G -> H -> I -> J -> K -> L -> M -> N -> O -> P -> A

So, the Hamiltonian Cycle for the given graph is A-B-C-D-E-F-G-H-I-J-K-L-M-N-O-P-A.
